Package ch.pschatzmann.jflightcontroller4pi.imu

A Inertial measurement unit (IMU) measures and reports a body's specific force, angular rate, and sometimes the orientation of the body, using a combination of accelerometers, gyroscopes, and magnetometers.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ICompass
    The compassmust provide the Degree and
    IIMU
    A IMU must provide a Quaternion
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Compass
    Converts a 3d Magnetometer output into 360 Degrees and Headings.
    IMU
    Determine the Pitch, Yaw, Roll and Heading with the help of a gyro, accelerometer and magnetometer information form the parameter store Implementation of Madgwick's IMU and AHRS algorithms.
    IMUDevice
    Integration device for the Inertial measurement unit (IMU) into our Flight Controller
    Quaternion
    see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_between_quaternions_and_Euler_angles roll = Mathf.Atan2(2*y*w + 2*x*z, 1 - 2*y*y - 2*z*z); pitch = Mathf.Atan2(2*x*w + 2*y*z, 1 - 2*x*x - 2*z*z); yaw = Mathf.Asin(2*x*y + 2*z*w);
    Value3D
    3 D value: Accelerometer and Gyro and Magnetometers are providing their output in values for the x, y and z axis.
    Velocity
    We try to estimate the speed with the help of the accelerometer.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Compass.Heading  

Package ch.pschatzmann.jflightcontroller4pi.imu Description

A Inertial measurement unit (IMU) measures and reports a body's specific force, angular rate, and sometimes the orientation of the body, using a combination of accelerometers, gyroscopes, and magnetometers.
